hw my ex bf/bf makes me feel

Too many days have gone by
Where you have told me so many lies
Do I want to stay with you
Will you ever love me true
Do you love me the way i love you
Can I ever put my trust in you
I need proof that you will always be there
And no matter what you will always care
Life feels empty without you
But with you life feels so untrue
Ill always love you no matter what
But the question is do you love me or not
How could you have the heart to put me through all that pain
And act like everything is still the same
All this has made me so confused
And yet I still wanna be with you
I wanna hold you in my arms at night
I wanna be with you for the rest of my life
I just need you to be there for me too

my child poverty speech (in da speech sarah-anne is me)

Imagine going to your new school, on the first day in an old, second hand and faded uniform. You look around and see others in their new uniforms with neatly ironed creases and bold colors. You look back at yourself you suddenly feel out of place, like every one knows that your poor, so poor that you can’t afford a new uniform. But little do they know your uniform feels like the world to you just like what their uniform feels to them. This is what I call a minor case of New Zealand child poverty. New Zealand child poverty isn’t as serious as in the third world countries but it is similar.

What does child poverty mean to children in poverty?
Well for children poverty means missing out on what most of us take for granted.
For example not being sure of 3 meals a day, suitable clothing or not being able to heat the house in winter or missing out on school outings and not being able to bring home projects from tech classes because you haven’t paid the fees or it could just cause social isolation, feelings of worthlessness, loneliness and alienation.
It can also cause kids to drop out of school too early and therefore are more likely to be unemployed-even for high ability students, also kids under-achieving at school because of under eating which causes short attention spans

What happens when things get tight?
When money runs short it is still possible to get on with life. Most of your parents would have heard of the food bank. Food banks are great places to go to when you need a helping hand food wise. Some people find it humiliating living on hand outs all the time but the food bank is not a hand out; because you cant just live on the food bank day in and day out. The reason is that food banks give you the bare minimum to survive so you still have to go out and try and earn a living and I’m sure that if you were in the position of having to go to the food bank you probably rather get a job. The poorest people don’t own a house. Most won’t even be renting. They sleep in friend’s garages and in their cars. After Christmas 2003 on average 10 families a week had nowhere to go.

Who are out to stop it?
Well I’m just one of thousands of people that think child poverty is completely outrageous. There are celebrities out to stop it like Blind Spot (Band), Dave Dobbyn (Singer), Frankie Stevens (Singer), Judy Bailey (Former One News Presenter), Milan Borich (Singer from Pluto), Opshop (Band), Shane Cortese (Actor, Dom off Shortland Street), All Blacks (NZ Rugby team)

There are also organizations out to stop it like CPAG (child poverty action group), CYFS (child youth and family), Child Welfare, Social Welfare, Make poverty history and Habitat for humanity. You all know the guy off the condom add with the catchy rap a but you probably don’t know that he is also trying to cut down child poverty by reducing the pregnancies of young people like us that aren’t financially capable to raise a child. But not all child poverty is caused by children giving birth to children it can also be caused by an illness or disability of the main breadwinner in a family which means the under qualified members have to go to work and end up in dead end jobs that pay next to nothing. One particular true story has come to my attention. It’s about a girl by the name of Sarah-Anne Black. She lived in Ngaruawahia she was about 2 or 3 when her dad, the main income in the family, got sick with Bi Polar which caused him to get depressed and violent very easy, this happened a lot, so they were very low on money.

Most of you in this room would have gone to school in new, flash clothes she went to school in clothes from the Op shop, you probably also had a large group of friends her friends were the walls of the classroom. Her mum couldn’t take her dads violence because she was constantly protecting the kids, taking the punches and dealing with the bruises so she left and took the kids with her. Sarah and her two brothers lived mainly with their mum and made organized visits to see their dad. Sarah’s mum was on the benefit, due to her still not working, and was trying her best to re qualify her self so that she could go to work.

Sarah, who would have been about 6 or 7, was constantly being beaten up and bullied at school along with her older brother Michael who would have been about 8 or 9. They were being bullied because of the way they looked and the clothes they wore no one bothered to get to know them they just judged them by their appearance and their often visits to the nest (the food bank in Hamilton). Her mum was constantly being stalked by her ex-husbands family. She had already met a friend over the internet and was contemplating over the idea of moving over to Rotorua and the drama with her ex-husband made the decision for her so they moved. Her mum got a full time job and had a steady income. Sarah made a few friends at her new school. Her mum met someone in Whakatane his name was Mike Anderson they moved up there about two years after they met. Her mum got a high paying job and mike worked at the board mill so they had a very steady income. They still get short on money today but with two incomes there’s always a way through it.

You are probably wondering how you can help. Well if you are wondering how to help people in need such as Sarah and others overseas white bands are available online at Oxfam, World Vision and TEAR fund and offline from the Leprosy mission and Trade aid

Thank you for listening. I hope I made a difference to your outlook on child poverty in New Zealand

today

today i had a fight with my mum. she started judgin my friends nd sayin dat sum of them wernt gud enough for me....... it all started when i went out wiv my ex bf kerry, kerry was kind of a "no hoper" as some people would say. he was the first ever bf i took 2 meet my mum nd step dad. when he met my family instantly my brothers and poppa were drwn 2 him and his funny jokes, but my mother, nana, and my step dad saw him as some1 that would bring me down. once he had left after meeting my parents my mum sed straight 2 my face he is no gud 4 u and all hes gonna du is bring u dwn. after that i ddnt speak 2 her 4 about 2 or 3 days im mean come on who is she to judge the person i luvd.jst resently my m8 got a bf nd me nd him became m8 he called me his sister nd i called him my brother, heis 20 nd i rang him coz he was dwn nd my mum pickd up the fone and was listening us tlkin wen i got off da fone she asked me hu i was tlkin 2 her nd i told her hu it was nd dat he was also a friend of mine and once again she sedc straight up 2 my face hes a player. so today wen me nd my m8 were tlkin bout him mum got into the covosation nd gave us her opinion if him. i basically broke dwn nd cried because everyfing i du 4 her seems 2 b either da rong fing or nt enough........

i dnt no

i dnt no hw 2 deal wiv my bfs mood swings nemreevry few days he sayin "uve changed" nd "i think if lost u" nd "it doesnt feel da same nemre" nd den 5 min later i get a txt sayin hes sorry nd dat he was havin a bad day nd dat he shouldnt of taken it out on me. i cnt even say nething 2 him wiv out him gettin suspicious of me cheatin on him wen ive told him countless times dat i would neva eva dream of doin dat 2 him..... i dnt no wot 2 du!!!!!!!!!

hes gone

my poppa died yesterday. hes was funny nd a great person before he got sick nd ended up in a rest home.he died listening 2 his scottish music nd a lady singing my nana and his favourite song. he was such a great grandad im gonna miss him so much

R.I.P Poppa i love you

rele sad

girl:hey

boy- i missed u at school 2day, y weren't u there?

girl- yeah, i had to go to the doctor.

boy- oh rele? y?

girl- oh nothin, annual shots, thats all.

boy- oh

girl- so wht did we do in math 2day?

boy- u didnt miss ne thing that great.......just lots of notes

girl- ok good

boy- yeah

girl- hey i have a question......

boy- ok, ask away

girl-........how much do u love me?

boy- u kno i love u more than anything

girl- yeah.....

boy- y did u ask?

girl-................>silence<..........

boy- is something wrong?

girl- no nothing at all

boy- good.
girl- ..............how much do u care about me?

boy- i would give u the world in a heartbeat if i could.

girl- u would?

boy- yeah.........of course i would >sounding worried< is there something wrong??

girl- no, everythings fine......

boy- are u sure?

girl- yeah.

boy- ok.......i hope so.

girl- ..............would u die for me?

boy- i would take a bullet for u anyday, hun

girl- rele?

boy- anyday. now seriously, is there something wrong???

girl- no im fine, ur fine, we're fine, everyones fine.

boy- ............ok

girl-......................well i have to go ill c u 2morrow at school.

boy- alright, bye. I LOVE YOU.

girl- yeah, i love u 2, bye.

THE NEXT DAY AT SCHOOL:

boy- hey, have u seen my g/f 2day?

friend- no

boy- oh.

friend- she wasnt here yesterday either.

boy- i know, she was acting all wierd on the phone last nite.

friend- well dude u kno how gurls are sumtimes

boy- yeah........but not her.

friend- idk wht else 2 say, man.

boy- k well i gotta get 2 english, ill c ya after school.

friend- yeah i gotta get to science, ttyl.

THAT NIGHT:

-ring-
-ring-
-ring-
-ring-
girl- hello?

boy- hey

girl- oh, hi.

boy- y weren't u at school 2day?

girl- uh.......i had another doctor appointment.

boy- are u sick?

girl- ..................um i have 2 go, my mom's callin on my other line.

boy- ill wait.

girl- it may take a while, ill call u later.

boy-........alright, i love u hun.

very long pause<

girl- (with tear in her eye) look, i think we should break up.

boy- what???

girl- its the best thing for us right now.

boy- y????

girl- i love u.
click<

THE GIRL DOESNT COME TO SCHOOL FOR 3 MORE WEEKS, AND DOESNT ANSWER HER PHONE.

boy- hey dude

friend- hey

boy- whats up

friend- nothin, hey have u talked 2 ur ex lately?

boy- no

friend- so u didnt hear?

boy- hear what?

friend- um idk if i should be the one to tell u......

boy- dude, wtf tell me

friend- uh....call this number....433-555-3468

boy- ok............

BOY CALLS NUMBER AFTER SCHOOL

-ring-
-ring-
-ring-
voice- hello, suppam county hospital, this is nurse beckam.

boy- uh.......i must have the wrong number, im looking for my friend.

voice- what is her name, sir?
(boy gives info)

voice- yes, this is the right number, she is one of our patients here.

boy- rele? y? what happened??? how is she???

voice- her room number is ..646, in building A, suite 3.

boy- WHT HAPPENED??!!!!

voice- plz come by sir and you can see her, goodbye.

boy- WAIT! NO!
*dial tone*

BOY GOES TO HOSPITAL, AND TO ROOM ..646, BUILDING A, SUITE 3. GIRL IS LYING IN THE HOSPITAL BED.

boy- omg are u ok??

girl- ..................

boy- sweetie!! talk to me!!

girl- i..........

boy- u what?? U WHAT???

girl- i have cancer and im on life support

boy- .....................>breaks into tears<......................

girl- they're taking me off 2night

boy- y??

girl- i wanted 2 tell u but i couldnt

boy- y didnt u tell me????

girl- i didnt want 2 hurt u.

boy- u could never hurt me

girl- i just wanted 2 c if u felt bout me as the same i felt bout u.

boy- ?

girl- i love u more than anything, i would give u the world in a heartbeat. i would die for you and take a bullet for you.

boy- ...........

girl- dont be sad, i love u n ill always be here w/u

boy- then y'd u break up w/me?

nurse- young man, visiting hours are over.

BOY LEAVES, GIRL IS TAKEN OFF LIFE SUPPORT, AND DIES.

but wht the boy didn't kno is that the girl only asked him those questions so she could hear him say it one last time, and she only broke up w/him because she knew she only had 3 more weeks to live, and thought it would cause him less pain and give him time to get over her before she died.

NEXT DAY

the boy is found dead with a gun in his hand..with a note in the other...
THE NOTE SAID:i told her i would take a bullet for her....just like she said she would die for me...

re-post his within 10 minutes or else the one you love will die

the funeral

my grandads funeral was on tuesday. i went to see him on monday bcoz it was a closed casket service. he looked so peaceful and he didnt look sick any more... i cried. the plan for the funeral was that my dad and my uncle would be at the head of the casket, my other two uncles married into the family would be in the middle and my brother and great uncle would be at the foot end. and then me, my little brother and my cousin would walk in with his cuilt ,hat, tie, and bag (scottish outfit). and my nanan and aunties would come in after us.we we were standing there waiting for the boys to put the casket down and my little brother, who was standing beside me, started crying because of the bagpipes we led him in to. i reached over and stuck my arm around him nd gave him a hug, took him up to put his stuff on the coffin and took him to his seat. the glich with the seating was that my dads girlfriend aka the bitch was sitting behind us.the start of the funeral went well no1 cried up until the first song which was Could I have This Dance By Foster and Alan. then the tears flowed.... i managed to keep myself together my little brother started sobbing nd behind me was my uncle crying more than anything with his wife trying to soothe him. the song ended with great relief and we had a tribute from Jim Black one of the men that immigrated to new zealand with my grandad and we heard about all sorts of mischeif my grandad got up to in his younger days such as putting bunks in showers while people were on deck having dinner. after the tributes they played a song for my grandad which was Mull Of Kintyre By Wings. well that song made us all cry. wen my little brother started crying one of my aunties made him go sit next to her and gave him a big hug.... but what really amazed me was the aunty that didnt really show much emotion towards me came over when she realised my dads girlfriend was rubbing my back ( and i was trying my hardest to get away from her) and gave my a big hug. at the end of the service we all got rose petals and put them on the casket to sat our last goodbyes and then without any plan what so ever everyone waited until me and my cousin (the two grandaughters) took ahold of my nana, who was struggling to walk away from her husband, and walked out of the church with everyone else i tow. after the service i lost count of how many people thought that it was planned.
I hope we did you proud grandad
we all love you
R.I.P we miss you heaps.

if u hate drunk drivers sign it

I went to a party,
And remembered what you said.
You told me nt to drink, Mum
So i had a sprite instead.
I felt proud of meself,
The way you saud i would,
That i didnt drink and drive,
Though other friends said i should.
I made a healthy choice,
And your advice was right,
The party finally ended,
And the kids drove out of sight.
I got into my car,
Sure to get home in one peice,
I never knew what was comming, Mum
Something i expected least.
Now i lying on the pavement,
And i hear the policeman say,
The kid that caused this wreck was drunk,
Mum his voice seems so far away.
My own blood is all around me,
As i try hard not to cry,
I can hear the paramedic say,
This girl is going to die.
Im sure the guy had no idea,
While he was flying high,
Because he chose to drink and drive,
Now i would have to die.
So why do people do it, Mum
Knowing that it ruins lives?
And now the pain is cutting me,
Like a hundred stabbing knives.
Someone should have taught him,
That its wrong to drink and drive.
Maybe if his parents had,
Id still be alive.
My breath is getting shorter, Mum
Im getting really scared,
Theses are my final moments,
And im so unprepared.
I wish that you could hold me Mum,
As i lie here and die.
I wish that i could say "I love you Mum!"
So i love you and goodbye.
